His shop is located in the center Al Agjabedi bazaar, and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits and vegetables. His monthly income from this business is 200 AZN. 

Babak want to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his sales turnover as well as improve the life of his family. For this purpose, he applied for a 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase sales turnover

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is from the village of Khutsubani, West Georgia. He is 60 years old and lives with his family – his wife, Inga; his 30-year-old daughter; and his 15-year-old son. 

Nugzar’s daughter is a pharmacist and works in a local pharmacy. His son goes to school. Nugzar is leading the agricultural business of the family. They grow citrus, persimmon and nuts on 0.4 hectares of family-owned land. Harvested products are sold locally to greengrocery-products retailers. Inga is a teacher of Georgian literature. She gives lessons to pupils at home. She has up to 10 pupils. They come to lessons three times a week. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Nugzar requested credit for the renovation of a room in their house, which is used as a classroom by Inga. After renovation and purchasing necessary furniture, Inga can have more pupils. The income of the family will increase, and they hope that the family will be able to make some savings for renovating the rest of the rooms in their house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a classroom renovation.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es: Una mujer humilde y trabajadora, así es  Clementina de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo Víctor de 47 años y sus cuatro hijos en la casa que gran esfuerzo lograron comprar. Clementina, es una mujer luchadora; con gran esfuerzo y perseverancia después de 15 años obtuvo su tienda de ropa en la localidad de Palmapampa; donde ofrece la mejor variedad. Ella sabe que hay competencias con sus demás compañeras que laboran el mismo oficio; por encima de eso ella logra atender con amabilidad y paciencia a sus compradores, es así que llega tener clientes que la visitan cada fin de mes porque saben que en esos días le llegan ropa exclusivas que salen de moda en la ciudad de Lima. Sus planes a futuro es poder agrandar su tienda y variar sus ventas vendiendo ropas y zapatos. Este será su crédito número 06 con MFP y asegura ser puntual como hasta hoy, también dice estar contento con su banco comunal ya que todos son responsables. Con el dinero comprará más prendas de vestir, porque se está quedando sin mercadería y eso no le ayuda para nada en las ganancias.
texts.en:
Clementina, 46, is a modest and hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband Víctor, 47, and her four children in the house that they managed to buy with great effort.  Clementina is a fighter.  With great effort and perseverance, after 15 years she got her clothing store in the town of Palmapampa, where she offers the best variety.

She knows there is competition with her other friends who work in the same job; beyond that she manages to serve her customers kindly and patiently.  This is how she happens to have customers who visit her at the end of every month, because they know that on those days she gets exclusive clothing that is in style in the city of Lima.  Her plans for the future are to be able to expand her store and vary her sales, selling more clothing and shoes.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP and she guarantees she will be punctual as up to now.  She also says she is happy with her communal bank because everyone is very responsible.

With the money she will buy more articles of clothing because she is without merchandise and this does not help her at all with her profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en:
Namiq is a twenty-one-year-old man who lives with his wife and parents. He is a cattle breeder and has three years of experience in this field. Namiq chose this particular activity because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and most of the national dishes like dolma and pilau are made of meat. 

Namiq usually buys small calves in the central bazaar, fattens and raises them for 5-6 months. Then he resells the grown cattle for a more profitable price to market vendors and butchers.  His father helps to look after the animals and to feed them. He also breeds bulls because bull's milk and yoghurt is a rare product and considered as a delicacy. 

Demand for fresh meat is very high and Nail would like to be able to answer the demand of his permanent clients. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will use the loan to buy two baby calves and one small bull.

loans.use: to buy two baby calves and one small bull.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a forty-four-year-old food stall owner in Mariakani. She is married. She has been operating her business for the last four years. Her business is doing great.

This is her third business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase assorted food stuffs and also renovate her stall. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and purchase more stock. 

She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted food stuffs and also renovate her stall.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is fifty-two years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is married to Mary a farmer. They are blessed with one child. He has been a farmer for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan term from KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loans successfully. Justus will use the loan to pay school fees for his child. 

With the anticipated profit from the farming business he will buy another piece of land. His hopes and dreams are to educate his child up to university level.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Hendriah

texts.en:
Hendriah is a mother of one. She has been in farming for six years. Her farm produces and sells milk, vegetables, eggs and tomatoes on the local market within her home area of Kitale. She is aged twenty-five and has previously had two loans of 31,200 KES and 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo which she used to buy and insure dairy cows.

Hendriah has requested a loan of 102,000 KES. She will use 52,000 KES to help buy and insure another dairy cow, 30,000 KES to build a dairy unit, and will boost her poultry farming by buying 20,000 KES of poultry birds. 

She aspires to keep on improving the number of her dairy cows and also to buy a motorcycle to help delivering her produce to the market as well as tp earn more from transport services offered to other farmers.

She reiterates that diseases remain a challenge to farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow, build a dairy unit and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is aged forty-seven and has been in farming for six consecutive years. She is married with seven children, with the last two being in school. Her farm produces  milk and poultry birds for the local market. She adds that her family relies fully on farming since she started in the farming business six years ago.

Zipporah has requested a loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use to loan to buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and buy more poultry birds at 30,000 KES. She says she hopes to improve her farming income and boost her family's living standards.

Her challenge she says remains animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow as well as purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a single lady aged thirty and a mother of three children. She buys and sells milk in Kaptumo trading centre and she has been in this business for a period of three years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is requesting a third loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd. after she repaid the previous ones successfully. She wishes to use this amount to pay the milk suppliers. The profits will be used to expand her farm and rear dairy cows.  

Her dream is to prosper in business and educate her school-going children.

loans.use: To pay her milk suppliers.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is aged twenty-six. She has been in farming since her childhood but more actively in the last nine years. She currently runs her farm with one farmhand and produces maize, milk and beans for the local market. She also runs a retail shop in the local market.

Stella has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds, construct a poultry housing unit as well as purchase starting feeds for her project. She says she hopes to expand her farming acreage for all her farm produce but with more focus on her poultry business as it has a faster rate of return and there is a ready market in the area. She adds her hopes for financial stability rest on farming and more specifically on the poultry business.

She is worried though about the high cost of inputs for all farming activities.

loans.use: To build a poultry housing unit and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Ann is fifty years old, married, with four children aged twenty-seven, twenty-three, eighteen and sixteen. She sells clothes, a business she ventured into five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 50,000 that she will use to purchase new clothes and cereal products. The profit she earns from this business will help her educate her children. 

Her dream is to be successful and open up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and cereal products such as maize and beans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty-five years old a business lady, she is married to Charles a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been a charcoal dealer for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,500 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy sacks of charcoal. 

She will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a charcoal store.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Tomasa, se ha decido por cancelar el préstamo anterior para obtener una nueva deuda, que para ella será una nueva experiencia, de la cual espera resultados favorable, Tomasa quiere seguir en su oficio de la agricultura, pero además ahora comprara útiles escolares, y como siempre los insumos abono, herbicidas, semilla.
Ella ha tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, sus cosechas fueron buenas, estando mejor ahora que antes del préstamo. 
Sus ultimos pagos registrados fueron con un atraso de dias, esto no permite que el sistema la tome como recurrente o prestamo republicado, pero este es su segundo credito.
texts.en:
Tomasa has decided to cancel her previous loan in order to obtain a new one.  This will be a new experience for her and she hopes to obtain favorable results from it.  Tomasa would like to continue in her farming business but she will also buy school supplies.  In addition, as ever, she will buy supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides and seeds.

Tomasa's experience with her previous loan was good.  Her harvests were good, being better now than they were before she took out the loan.  The last repayments recorded for her were made a few days late.  This means that the system will not allow her to display as a recurring or republished loan but this is her second loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a mother and a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya where she lives with her family of three children aged between fifteen and six, all of whom are in school. Her farm produce, maize, beans, finger millet and milk, are all sold locally. She has been in farming for seven consecutive years.

Beatrice has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She believes this will double her dairy income and enable her to meet her family's needs especially the education of her children.

She is however aware of challenge posed by unreliable rains and the general high costs of inputs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es una mujer muy  hacendosa, tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposo Andrés y sus hijos, Wilmar de 13 años y Raúl de 11 años en su propia casa que con grandes esfuerzos lograron obtener. Durante 15 años se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles para el hogar como: arroz, azúcar, filetes, fideos, entre otros;  ella se levanta muy temprano para abrir las puertas de negocio ya que sus principales clientes son personas que van a trabajar muy temprano a los campos de cultivo.  Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es porque gracias a ello puede relacionarse con sus clientes y de esa  manera obtiene buena ganancia. Sin embargo le resulta preocupante al momento de que disminuya  poco a poco su mercadería  porque de esa forma no puede ofrecer los productos que exigen sus clientes. Sus planes a futuro es incrementar su puesto de ventas. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP y  asegura ser puntual en cada uno de sus cuotas, ya que está muy agradecida con los integrantes de este banco que le han dado la oportunidad de contar con un préstamo. Los 1,500 nuevos soles, es para que compre arroz, azúcar  y demás mercaderías relacionadas a su negocio.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a very hard-working woman.  She is 53 years old and lives with her husband Andrés and their children, 13-year-old Wilmar and 11-year-old Raúl.  They live in their own home which they managed to obtain through a lot of effort.  

For 15 years, Maximiliana has been selling groceries such as rice, sugar, meat, noodles, etc.  She gets up very early to open the doors of her business as her main customers are people who go out to work very early in the fields.  What she most enjoys about her work is that it allows her to interact with her customers and make good profits.  However, she becomes worried when her merchandise gradually starts to run down because it means she can't offer the products that her customers request.  Maximiliana's plan for the future is to expand her sales.

This will be Maximiliana's first loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making each one of her repayments as she is very grateful to the other members of this community bank who have given her the opportunity to take out a loan.  She will use the 1,500 soles to buy rice, sugar and other merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods and perishable products

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es:
Justiniano, se decidió por solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para comprar más repuestos para su taller de bicicletas, ya que vive de su negocio, por lo que la compra le ayudara para mantener en el inventario lo necesario para las necesidades de los clientes, comprara pedales, asientos, frenos, cadenas, tubos.
Él ha tenido un efecto positivo ya que logro satisfacer a los clientes, saliendo con los trabajos solicitados, esto por tener la disponibilidad de repuestos que obtuvo con el primer préstamo.
texts.en:
Justiniano decided to request a new loan so that he could buy more spare parts for his bicycle workshop as he lives off his business.  His purchase will help him to keep in stock everything he requires to meet his customers' needs.  He will buy pedals, saddles, brakes, chains and tubes.

His previous loan had a positive effect as he was able to satisfy his customers, completing jobs people requested.  This was because he had available the spare parts that he obtained with his first loan.

loans.use: to buy pedals, saddles, brakes, chains and tubes

loans.name: Muthengi

texts.en:
Muthengi is forty-one years old. An enterprising business man, he is married to Catherine, a business lady. They are blessed with two children aged ten and eight. He has been running a bakery for the past three years getting a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Muthengi will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and wheat flour. 

He will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a cake industry in his village.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 38 years old and married to Charles. They are blessed with three children, age 18,13 and 9. She sells new materials clothing, a business she has been in for eight years now and earns a monthly income of about KES 40,000.

She is requesting a loan amount of KES 20,000 to buy more materials and ladies' handbags.The profit earned from her business would enable her to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. Naomi's hopes and dreams are to open a shop of her own and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy materials and ladies' bags to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a farmer and a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya, where she lives with her family of four children and a husband, with all the children going to school and aged between 13 and 6 years. She has been in mixed farming for 6 years and currently supplies her farm products of milk, maize and potatoes to the local market.

Mildren has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming. This is her third loan with Juhudi Kilimo and she says that the previous loan helped open her eyes to the farming business, and she is glad and optimistic that she can now spread her risk by making entry into poultry farming as well. She aspires to rival the major suppliers in the market in a few years to come.

She states, however, that diseases remain a challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Armida Del Carmen

texts.es: Armida, necesita darle seguimiento al crecimiento del negocio, por eso está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de aceite, carnes, gaseosas, pastas, para cubrir la venta de pupusas y de comida, ella considera haber tenido un efecto positivo de la inversión anterior, manteniéndose en el negocio y con aumentos en las ventas.
texts.en: Armida needs to continue growing her business.  For this reason, she is requesting a new loan with which to buy oil, meat and pasta for her pupusas and food sales business.  She considers her previous investment to have had a positive effect as she was able to keep her business running and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, soda and pasta

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a married man. He has a daughter who is 3 years old. He describes himself as determined and focused. He operates a grocery stall where he sells fruits such as pineapples, watermelons, bananas, mangoes and pineapples. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located near a busy murram road (gravel) and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortages of charcoal. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase more fruits for selling. Gabriel's business goal is to expand his business and use the profits  generated to venture into a new business of providing transportation by buying a motorbike within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit for selling.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del Banco comunal “La Gula” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Ella se dedica a la preparación de comida, específicamente tortas, pasteles, humitas, entre otros productos. Se desempeña en este negocio desde hace 6 años.
Ella ofrece sus productos y sus clientes llegan a su domicilio a comprar.
Comenta que sus insumos los compra directamente en bodegas y/o distribuidoras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará harina, manteca y margarina.
Una de sus metas es instalar un local establecido en su propia casa. Continuar con las preparaciones, pero agregar venta de provisiones.
Patricia vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas de 21 y 12 años de edad, su hija mayor estudia cocina.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en: Patricia is a member of “La Gula” community bank, which is located in the city of Valparaíso. Her business is preparing food, specifically cakes, pies, humitas and other products. She has been in this business for six years. Her customers come to her home to buy from her. Patricia tells us that she buys her supplies directly in grocery stores and / or from wholesalers as these are places where she finds her merchandise at low prices which makes it financially convenient. She will use her loan to buy flour, butter and margarine. One of Patricia's goals is to set up business premises in her own home. She would like to continue making her food but also start selling provisions. Patricia lives together with her husband and her two daughters who are 21 and 12 years old. Her eldest daughter is studying cookery. Patricia is very happy and grateful for the opportunity she is being given by Fondo Esperanza as this loan will allow her to invest in her business. She also feels comfortable with her community bank which encourages her to continue working with the institution. She also says that the training sessions that take place during the meetings have helped her to better invest in her business. Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers to the north-east of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the seat of the country's legislative power. It is the most important port in the country and has a lot of beautiful and picturesque places such as, for example, the home of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and margarine

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprarse variedad de ropa, como camisas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos, con esta inversión espera surtir el negocio y aumentar la venta, para generar mayores ganancias, logrando un buen efecto en el negocio y en su vida, así como el préstamo anterior.
Su familia se ha mantenido, las ventas, los ingresos, han aumentado, haciendo más solvente su situación.
texts.en: Carlos is requesting a new loan to buy a range of clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses and dresses.  With this investment, he hopes to stock his business, increase his sales and make bigger profits, which will have a positive effect on both his business and his life, as was the case with his previous loan.  He has managed to support his family and his sales and income have risen.  This has made him more solvent.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, blouses and dresses

loans.name: Juan Mario

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un préstamo por su buen historial y experiencia para el manejo de estas inversiones, quiere comprarse nuevamente material de limpieza, para seguir distribuyendo y ofreciendo a los clientes.
Su experiencia con los préstamos es excelente, ya que ha sabido utilizar el dinero que se le otorga, manteniéndose en su negocio.
texts.en: Juan is requesting a loan because of his good record and experience in managing these investments.  Once more, he wants to buy cleaning materials so that he can continue selling them and offering them to his customers.  His experience with loans is excellent as he has known how to use the money which he is given to keep his business running.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 57-year-old businessman, and he is married to Josephine, a farmer. They are blessed with four children aged 16, 12 and eight years respectively. He has been in a livestock trading business for the past four years with the monthly income of about KES 11,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Michael will use the loan to buy more livestock for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: To buy more livestock for selling.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 30 years old and a businessman. He is married to Tabitha, who is a housewife. They are blessed with one child, aged three years. He has been running a retail shop for the past two years with the monthly income of about KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Paul will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his business. 

He will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his business.

loans.name: Daria

texts.es: Daria es una mujer humilde y de buen carácter, tiene 52 años. Habita en su propia casa a lado de su esposo Bonifacio de 54 años y sus 05 hijos ya mayores. Durante toda su vida Daria se ha dedicado a la siembra y cosecha; y ahora gracias a esta actividad logró obtener su propio terreno de cultivo donde siembra plantas de cacao y café, productos que en tiempos de cosecha los lleva a vender a los centros de acopio de su localidad. Al principio lo hacia sola, pero desde que formo su familia recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hijos quienes la apoyan en lo momentos difíciles. Eventualmente en los tiempos donde la lluvia es permanente, las plagas aparecen y logran dañar sus plantaciones; pero Daria se esmera por mantenerlas fértiles ya que es el sustento de su hogar. Con el lapso del tiempo piensa incrementar más plantas, ya que es la actividad que mas le gusta aunque tenga muchas dificultades que afrontar. Este será su crédito número 06 con MFP, su compromiso es seguir trabajando responsablemente, ya que esté préstamo es de mucha ayuda para la marcha y el crecimiento de su chacra. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y puntual en las reuniones. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de sus plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Daria is a modest woman of good character.  She is 52 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband, 54-year-old Bonifacio, and their five adult children.  Daria has been planting and harvesting her whole life.  Thanks to this work, she has managed to obtain her own plot of farmland where she sows cacao and coffee plants.  When she harvests her crops, she takes them to the warehouses in her town and sells them.  At first, Daria worked alone but, since she started her family, she has received the help of her husband and children who support her during difficult times.  During periods of the year when rain is a permanent feature, pests eventually appear and they manage to destroy her plantations.  However, Daria takes a lot of care to keep them fertile as they are her household's means of support.  Over time, Daria plans to increase her number of plants as this is the work that she most enjoys, even though she has to face many difficulties.

This will be Daria's sixth loan from MFP.  She pledges to continue working responsibly as this loan is very helpful to the running and growth of her farm.  Daria is a very responsible member of her community bank who is punctual in attending meetings.  She will use her 1,000 soles to buy fertilizers with which to maintain her cacao and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Lucia De Jesus

texts.es:
Lucia, quiere seguir cultivando la agricultura, por eso está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, ya que con su apoyo ha logrado que sus cultivos sean más provechosos, en esta deuda él cubrirá el gasto de insumos como abono, herbicidas, pago de alquiler de terreno, para iniciar el proceso con todos los materiales necesarios.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, la familia se ha mantenido, su hijo sigue estudiando y él con el mejor deseo de tener un buen desempeño con la nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Lucia would like to continue farming.  She is requesting a new loan because, with the support of her previous loan, she managed to make her crops more profitable.  She will use this loan to cover the cost of supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides.  She will also pay land rental.  In this way, she will be able to start her sowing with all the materials she needs.

Lucia's previous loan had positive results.  She supported her family, her son continues studying, and her biggest wish now is for her new plantings to be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay land rental

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 26 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is single and she has three children between 2 and 8 years old. Two are currently in school and all of them live at home. For the past eleven years she has been selling rice, oil and pepper in the market. She enjoys the profit making in the business. Hawa is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil and pepper for her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en: Zeddy has paid back her previous loans, and her business is doing well. She earns a monthly income of about KES10,000 and requires a loan of KES 60,000 to pay for cement, sand and paints. The profit earned will help her expand her business. This is her fifth loan.

loans.use: to pay for cement, sand and paints.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is from the village Akhalsheni, West Georgia. He is 23 years old, unmarried, and lives with his parents. His mother is a housewife. His father works as a barber in the village. Avtandil is leading the agricultural business of the family. He takes care of a milk cow, produces cheese and sells on average 10 kg of this product locally. He also grows citrus and vegetables on a family owned 0.5 hectare plot of land. Harvested products are sold to local greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income for the family is about 1,000 Laris. 

Avtandil requested credit for the purchasing of new saplings of various fruit trees. He will plant them on his plot and after 3-5 years will get more harvest. Consequently, the income from fruit sales will increase and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fruit tree saplings.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is thirty-nine years old. He is married and lives in the village of Charnali with his family: his wife – Gulnara, three children (19, 13 and 7 years old) and his parents who are retired. Gela is a worker in a construction company. Along with his main job he is also actively involved in the family's agricultural business. They own 0.6 hectares of land, where they grow fruits and vegetables. The products that they harvest are sold to local greengrocery retailers. The family also has two milk cows, and Gulnara produces cheese and sells it locally. Gela takes care of 55 bee-hives, owned by the family. He gathers honey twice a year and sells it locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Laris which includes the pensions of Gela’s parents.

Gela requested credit to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse. He will grow various vegetables in the greenhouse during the whole year. The harvested vegetables will be sold to partner greengrocery retailers. The income of the family will significantly increase. Gela will be able to improve the family's living conditions, and finance the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty-seven years old. An enterprising business lady, she is married to Nelson, a business man. They are blessed with two children. She has been selling fruits as a primary business and ladies-wear as a secondary business for the past two years. She makes a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy fresh fruits and new clothes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop and a greengrocer which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits and new clothes.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza es una mujer obstinada a su trabajo, pero de buena actitud, tiene a su  hija Jessica de 10 años. Actualmente tiene 27 años y mantiene el mimso optimismo de salir adelante. Vive en su propia casa que llegaron a comprar con su esposo Hugo de 30 años. Se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando plantas de café. En esta actividad lleva hace 15 años y le resulta rentable ya que tiene la mejor producción que sus demás vecinos. Su labor de trabajo empieza desde muy tempranas horas con la ayuda de su esposo, porque de esa manera logran avanzar rápido con su faena, quitando  las malezas que ocasiona daño a su cultivo. Le gusta su trabajo  y esta contenta con lo que hace, aunque tenga que ser muy dificultoso. Ahora lo que más prioriza es poder arreglar la fachada de su casa. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual porque de ser así podrá acceder a otro crédito. En su banco es una socia responsable y solidaria. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará  cemento, pintura y otros materiales que requieran el arreglo de su casa.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a tenacious woman when it comes to her work.  She has a good attitude.  She has one daughter, Jessica, who is 10 years old.  Esperanza is 27 years old and she continues making progress with the same optimism.  She lives in her own home which she bought together with her husband, 30-year-old Hugo.  

Esperanza is a farmer and grows coffee plants.  She has been in this business for 15 years and it is profitable because she has the best production of all her neighbors.  Her work starts very early in the morning.  She works with the help of her husband because, in this way, they make quicker progress in their work, removing weeds which damage their crops.

Esperanza enjoys her work and is happy with what she does, although it can be very difficult.  Right now, her biggest priority is fixing up the front of her home.

This will be Esperanza's fourth loan from MFP.  She knows that she must be punctual in making her repayments so that she can access another loan in the future.  She is a responsible and supportive member of her community bank.  She will use her 1,000 soles to buy cement, paint and other materials that she needs to fix up her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint and other materials with which to fix up her home

loans.name: Maria Sarbelia

texts.es: María, manifiesta que la decisión por el nuevo préstamo se debe a que, esta manera de trabajar le ha permitido crecer en el negocio, ya que se ofreció a los clientes mayor cantidad de productos para la tienda y pupusas; esta compra nueva será en  harina, levadura, maíz, azúcar, huevos, para continuar elaborando pan, ya que tambien le ayuda a diversificar los productos para la venta. Ella considera que ha tenido buenas experiencias con los prestamos, sirviéndole para salir adelante.
texts.en: María says that she decided to take out a new loan because this way of working has allowed her to grow her business.  She has been able to offer her customers a larger quantity of products and pupusas.  She will buy flour, yeast, corn, sugar and eggs, to continue making bread.  It helps her to diversify the products that she sells.  María believes that her experiences with loans have been good and that they have helped her to make progress.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, corn, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Jose Nehemias

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo totalmente en el taller, comprando equipo de soldadura y materiales, como hierro, tubos, polines, para continuar realizando trabajos a domicilio y así ganar cliente, por su responsabilidad en el trabajo.
Él ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, mejorando el taller y saliendo con algunos trabajos de los clientes.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan which he will invest, in its entirety, in his metal shop.  He will buy welding equipment and materials such as iron, tubes and posts, so that he can continue carrying out jobs at people's homes.  This will gain him customers because of his responsibility in his work.

José's previous loan had a positive effect as he improved his metal shop and finished some work for his customers.

loans.use: to buy iron, tubes and posts

loans.name: Fang

texts.en:
Fang is married with four children, and they all live in a five bedroom house in Ntabesi, a quarter in the Nkwen Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. The death of her first daughter, who was sick for four years before her death, made Fang spend all her money on medication. However, the child still died. This child was very supportive to her. The death of her father also made Fang more confused.

She promises that if given the loan requested she will buy and sell firewood, produce and powdered soap, and that she will also buy fertilizer, bean seedlings and yam seedlings, which will enable her to engage in agriculture and achieve a good yield. 

She holds strongly to the fact that her business will prosper because firewood and powdered soap are the essential things needed by her neighbors in their day to day life. She plans to buy and sell depending on their demands. With this activity, the community members will not have to go long distances in search of firewood to cook food and they will have powdered soap to wash their dresses. She will make sure there is availability at all times, and she will sell to them moderately as compared to other retailers. 

The profit from the loan will be used to educate her children, provide basic necessities for her family, assist family members who are in need and also allow her to be supportive to her husband in any way she can. 

According to her, she prefers GHAPE loans because the loans are paid in small installments, the interest rate is very low compared to other financial institutions, and members are being taught business management techniques before loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and powdered soap to sell, and fertilizer for bean and yam seedlings.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya where she has been in farming for over 20 years. She has been producing maize, beans, bananas and milk which she sells locally. She earns additional income from her pension benefits.

Francisca has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo after the first one of 35,000 KES. She says this loan will help her venture into poultry farming by buying poultry birds. She adds that she will use the income to educate her orphaned grandchildren. She also hopes to boost her dairy business from the poultry gains.

She laments of the poor prices for farm produce, pests and animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria siempre muy alegre, tiene 30 años y vive con su esposo Fermín de 39 años y sus hijos Yoselit de 14 años, Yelsin de  11 años y Cindy de 07 años, en su casa de material noble  que con gran esfuerzo lograron obtener. En la localidad de Palmapampa, la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican al cultivo de plantas de cacao, café y coca; uno de ellos es la señora Gloria y su esposo Fermín; ambos labran la tierra para luego cultivar sus plantas que durante 13 años realizan esta actividad. En los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de vecinos agricultores, ya que lo hacen de manera reciproca, lo cual la colecta de sus frutos lo realizan de forma rápida por tener mucha experiencia; después de la cosecha lo lleva a comercializar a los centros de acopio de su localidad donde le pagan buenos precios por cada kilogramo. Con el pasar del tiempo piensa en cultivar mas plantas ya que son rentables en las ventas de su producción. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP, promete pagar todas cuotas respectivamente, porque quiere seguir trabajando y sus obsesiones es de crecer con la ayuda de estos prestamos que da MFP. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café para poder incrementar en su campo de cultivo.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very cheerful woman.  She is 30 years old and lives with her husband, 39-year-old Fermín, and their children, 14-year-old Yoselit, 11-year-old Yelsin and 7-year-old Cindy.  They live in their own home which is built from solid building materials.  They obtained it through a lot of hard work.  It is located in the town of Palmapampa where most people work growing cacao, coffee and coca plants.  One of these people is Gloria (and her husband Fermín).  They both work the land so that they can then grow their plants.  They have been in this business for 13 years.  At harvest time, they have the support of their fellow farmers and neighbors as they work in a reciprocal manner.  They gather in the fruit quickly because they have a lot of experience.  After the harvest, they take their crops to the warehouses in their town where they receive a good price per kilogram.  In the future, Gloria is planning to grow more plants as they are profitable.

This will be Gloria's eighth loan from MFP.  She pledges to make all her repayments on time because she would like to continue working and her goal is to grow her business with the help of these loans that MFP provide.  She will use her 1,000 soles to buy coffee plants so that she can increase the number on her farm.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Asrorjon

texts.ru: Асрорджон женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Дети маленькие. Жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за детьми. Более 7 лет он занимается откормом крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Является собственником бизнеса. Ему в бизнесе помогает отец. Он начал свою деятельность с откорма 2-х голов крупного рогатого скота. На данный момент имеет 6 голов крупного и 4 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Асрорджон запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота и корма для них.
texts.en:
Asrorjon is married and the responsible father of two small children. His wife takes care of their family and household. 
Asrorjon owns a cattle-fattening business. He's worked on this business, with the help of his father, for more than seven years. He started out with two heads of large cattle. Now, his herd has increased to six heads of large cattle and four heads of small cattle. 
Asrorjon is asking for a loan in order to purchase some cattle and cattle feed

loans.use: To buy cattle and cattle feed.

loans.name: Sara Cecilia

texts.es: Sara, solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para sus cultivos como abono, herbicidas y semilla, para fortalecer y mejorar el crecimiento del cultivo, ella comenta que con el aporte de estos préstamo ha logrado realizar sus actividades, ya que en muchas situaciones no se cuenta con el dinero suficiente para tratar los cultivos, pero en su caso ha tenido buenas cosechas.
texts.en: Sara is requesting a loan to buy materials for her crops such as fertilizer, herbicides and seeds.  This will strengthen and improve the growth of her crops.  She says that, thanks to the support of these loans, she has managed to carry out her business as she often didn't have enough money to treat her crops.  She is now enjoying good harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
Sandra, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, con el fin de comprar productos para mantenerse en el negocio, la compra será de harina de arroz, semilla de marañón, leche, azúcar, canela, para hacer atoles, tambien quiere comprarse algunos materiales de costura como hilos, telas, botones, broches, para la sastrería.
Ella considera que estos préstamos son la mejor alternativa para mejorar en los negocios pequeños, dándoles la seguridad de mantenerse.
texts.en:
Sandra is requesting a new loan to buy products she needs to keep her business running.  She will buy rice flour, cashew nuts, milk, sugar and cinnamon for making 'atoles' (a corn-based beverage).  She would also like to buy some sewing supplies such as thread, buttons and clasps, for her sewing business.

Sandra believes that these loans are good for improving small businesses, enabling them to keep going.

loans.use: to buy rice flour, cashew nuts, milk, sugar and cinnamon

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 24 años de edad, es una mujer buena y afanosa en los que haberes de su hogar, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Admir José de 26 años, quienes desean tener un buen futuro con el tiempo. La actividad que realiza Maribel, es labrar la tierra en su propia chacra que hace 13 años llego a adquirir con mucho esmero. Maribel junto a su pareja elaboran el cuidado de sus plantas de cacao. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver los apreciados frutos que con el tiempo le resulta  beneficioso y esto es gracias a la manera como ha efectuado su trabajo. Por otra parte, plagas de insectos afecten sus siembras ya que son difíciles de liquidarlas. Es por eso que acude a MFP para requerir un préstamo para lograr sus objetivos de trabajo. Este será su crédito numero 02 con MFP y se siente contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo financiero. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, es decir, comprará abono y fertilizantes para la producción de su siembra.
texts.en:
24-year-old Maribel is a kind lady who is industrious when it comes to carrying out her housework.  She lives in her own home together with her partner, 26-year-old Admir José.  They hope to enjoy a good future.  Maribel's business is working the land on her own farm which she managed to acquire 13 years ago.  Maribel and her partner both care for their cacao plants.  What Maribel most enjoys about her work is being able to see the valued fruit which, over time, are profitable to her, owing to the way in which she has carried out her work.  On the other hand, pests affect her crops and they are difficult to get rid of.  For this reason, she has turned to MFP to request a loan, so that she can achieve her business goals.

This will be Maribel's second loan from MFP and she feels happy to know that she will receive financial support.  She will use her 2,000 soles to care for her crops.  That is to say, she will buy manure and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz de 39 años, es una señora muy hacendosa, vive en propia casa junto a su esposo Rómulo de 39 años y sus 07 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Beatriz, una mujer compasiva dedicada a su trabajo en los campos de cultivo donde le brinda bastante cuidado a su cultivo de café; ya que su familia depende de la producción de sus frutos. Lo que mas le gusta de trabajo es poder realizar junto a su esposo e hijos quienes le dan motivo para seguir adelante con la obtención de las  plantas de café, a la vez considera difícil sacar la  maleza que crecen en medio de las plantas de sus sembradíos. Hasta ahora cuenta con el apoyo de los financistas de MFP ya que ellos apoyan la manera como trabaja Maribel en su campo de cultivo. Este será su crédito numero 14 con MFP, se siente orgullosa de saber que una vez mas contará con el apoyo de ustedes. En su banco comunal es responsable con las reuniones que realizan. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar productos químicos para desyerbar las malezas y con el resto contratará jornaleros.
texts.en:
39-year-old Beatriz is a very hard-working lady.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 39-year-old Rómulo, and their seven beloved children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Beatriz is a compassionate woman who is committed to her work in the fields where she provides a lot of care for her coffee crops because her family depend on her crop production.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to work together with her husband and children who encourage her to make progress with her coffee plants.  However, she finds it difficult to get rid of the weeds that grow between her plants.  Up to now, she has had the support of MFP who support the way in which she works on her land.

This will be Maribel's fourteenth loan from MFP.  She feels proud to know that she will receive your support once again.  Maribel is a responsible member of her community bank.  She will use her 3,000 soles to buy chemical products to get rid of her weeds.  She will use the remaining sum to hire laborers.

loans.use: to hire laborers and to buy chemicals to get rid of weeds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Nkubu. He is married and has four children, all adults except for the last born who is still schooling. He has been in farming for more than 20 years. His farm currently produces milk, coffee and bananas, which he sells to the local markets. He earns additional income from his second-hand clothes sales.

Peter has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. This will be his second loan after the first one of 25,000 KES. He says he will buy poultry birds at 30,000 KES and dairy goats at 20,000 KES. He says this loan will boost his income and enable him pay the school fees for his youngest son and improve the living standards of his family.

Peter's greatest challenges are the high input costs and unreliable rains, especially for banana cultivation, because they require farmers to incur additional costs in irrigation.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and dairy goats.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the credit officers. She is applying for her fourth loan, for KES 50,000, to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to help assist her family and pay the school fees for her younger children.

Regina's goal for the future is to continue growing her business so she can give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with four children. She and her family live in Small Mankon, which is in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life such as the illness and death of family members and the problem of not being educated due to inadequate finances for school.

Florence says with the new loan she will buy piglets, food for the piglets and chicks, and she will also open a provision store where she will sell goods such as bread, sardines and other commodities. She is very positive her business will succeed because she has a good business site and a good attitude, causing her to attract more new customers. Also, she seeks advice from customers and always accepts their suggestions. With this activity, the community will always have a regular supply at all times.

The profit from the loan will be used to care for her children and pay for other family needs. She will also try to save regularly and invest some of the profit to expand her business. According to Florence, GHAPE loans are preferable because of the low interest rates and training before loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, chicks and a provision store.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.es: Betsy, de 29 años, es madre soltera pero trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pequeño hijo Henry de 02 años; quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Betsy, es una joven de lucro se dedica al negocio, su propósito es estar junto a su pequeño hijo sin descuidarlo. Hace 06 años llegó a abrir su tienda de abarrotes en la cual le resulta muy bien con las ventas que realiza ya que sus principales clientes son sus vecinos cercanos a ella. Betsy, comenta que hay ventajas y desventajas en su labor; por lo cual tiene que afrontar y seguir adelante con las ventas de su negocio para sobresalir en los gastos económicos. Desde que empezó a solicitar el préstamo de MFP ahora su negocio le va muy bien ya que de esa manera puede seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas de pago, asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por permitirle participar como socia. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará productos para su tienda como; arroz azúcar, detergentes, variedades de jabones, etc.
texts.en:
29-year-old Betsy is a hard-working single mother.  She lives in her own home together with her young son, 2-year-old Henry.  He is the motivation behind all her hard work.  Betsy is a young woman who is committed to her business.  Her goal is to be together with her young son and not neglect him.  Six years ago, she opened a grocery store which is doing very well.  Most of her customers are close neighbors.  Betsy says that there are advantages and disadvantages to her work.  She has to face her obstacles and make progress with her sales so that she can cover her expenses.  Since she started requesting loans from MFP her business has done very well she is able to continue achieving her plans for her business.

This will be Betsy's third loan from MFP.  She pledges to make her repayments on time.  She is grateful to her community bank for allowing her to become a member.  Betsy will use her 1,000 soles to buy products for her store such as rice, sugar, detergents, a range of soaps, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergents and a range of soaps

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
César es un padre de familia de 36  años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos menores de edad y viven en un  caserío rural de nombre Caracucho,  donde mayormente sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales como actividad económica principal, el caserío esta ubicado a 20 minutos del distrito de Mórrope, y el mismo a unas 2 horas aproximadamente de la provincia de Lambayeque.

César tiene como actividad económica la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales son alimentados y criados hasta crear el tamaño y peso ideal para su comercialización en los mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. La crianza y alimentación de sus animales son realizadas en corrales muy bien acondicionados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Su esposa de César se desempeña como profesora en el colegio del caserío donde viven.

César en su deseo de seguir creciendo en su negocio y satisfacer a su clientes ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa  por el monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con lo que comprará mas animales y su alimento respectivo.

César es una persona amable y tranquila muy querida en el caserío donde reside y muy solicitado por gran clientela que ha generado durante el tiempo que se viene dedicando a mencionada actividad.
texts.en:
César is a 36-year-old father who lives with his wife and two dependent children.  They live in a small rural village called Caracucho.  Most of the people who live in the village farm and raise livestock as their main business activity.  The village is located 20 minutes from Mórrope district which is, in turn, approximately two hours from Lambayeque province.

César's business activity is raising and selling animals.  He feeds them and raises them until they reach an ideal size and weight.  He then sells them in the markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque.  He feeds and raises his animals in very well equipped pens which are located outside his home.  César's wife is a teacher in the school in their village.

César would like to continue growing his business and satisfying his customers.  For this reason, he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles.  He will use it to buy more animals and their respective feed.

César is a friendly and calm person who is very well liked in his village.  His products are very much in demand from the large number of customers that he has attracted over the time that he has been working in this business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Roubatou

texts.fr:
Roubatou est une femme  âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un  agent de promotion sociale. Elle a 03 enfants, tous scolarisés. Le premier a 18 ans et le dernier a 14 ans.  
Roubatou travaille comme revendeuse de friperies, d’ignames et autres depuis 1994. 
Elle vend avec une personne au marché et n’a pas de difficultés.
Roubatou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames et autres.  Elle veut agrandir son activité en ouvrant un magasin en ville pour la vente de friperie afin d’alléger les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Roubatou is a 42-year old woman who is married to a social advancement official. She has three children who are all at school. The eldest is 18 years old and the youngest 14. 

Roubatou has been working as a retailer of second-hand clothing, yams and other products since 1994. She sells her products with another person in the market and has no difficulties.

Roubatou has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy yams and other products. She wants to expand her business by buying a shop in town to sell second-hand clothing so that she can reduce her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Vicenta Betza

texts.es:
Vicenta es una mujer de 37 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropa americana todo comenzó cuando su tia le envía ropa de E.E.U.U. y comenzo con las ventas a sus amigas y amigos. esta arreglando un departamento para poder alquilar y recibir mas ingresos no tiene ninguna dificultad no esta casada tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 14 años su sueño es mejorar su vivienda para poder dar una mejor vida a sus logros en su futuro desea poner un restaurante de comida rápida. 

Quiere seguir con sus ventas por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo ropa como blusas, pantalones para seguir con el negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Vicenta, 37, has many aspirations for her business, selling American clothes, to prosper in the coming years.  It all started when her aunt sent her clothes from the United States.  She started selling to her friends.  

She is fixing up an apartment in order to be able to rent and get more income.  She has not had any difficulties.

She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 14.  Her dream is to improve her house in order to be able to give a better life to her family.  In the future she wishes to establish a fast food restaurant.

She wants to continue with her sales.  She wants to use the loan to buy blouses and pants to continue with her business of selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy blouses and pants.

loans.name: Diamaguene Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité de Diamaguene a été crée le 21/12/2009. Il est composé de 09 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles font comme activité principale le commerce.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. 
Elle est âgée de 31 ans et a en charge sa nièce. 
Avec son prêt elle compte acheter de la farine de blé, de l'huile et du sucre pour la préparation des beignets. Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'avoir une autonomie financière pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
The Diamaguene solidarity group was set up on 31st December 2009 and is made up of nine women from the same neighborhood. Their main activity is trading.

The woman who is responsible for the group is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised; she is married and mother to three children. She is 31 years old and also has her niece in her care.

With her loan she is planning to buy wheat-flour, oil and sugar for making fritters. The profits she makes will enable her to be financially independent and provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy wheat-flour, sugar and oil to make fritters

loans.name: Denadi Marcelline

texts.fr: Marcelline est mariée , agée de 38 ans,  et mère de  quatre enfants. Elle dispose d'une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des tissus . Elle a demandé un financement auprès de Finadev en vue d'acquerir une grande part de marché ce qui lui permettra d'etre au petit soin à ses proches.
texts.en: Marcelline is married, 38 years old and mother to four children. She has a shop where she sells fabrics. She has requested a loan from Finadev with a view to gaining a large market share, which will allow her to attend to all her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 25 pieces of fabric

loans.name: Juliet Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of primary-school teachers from Fadugu Village, near Kabala Town. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 5,300,000 leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will use their salaries to repay the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayment on their behalf.

Juliet is the leader of this group of teachers. The 40-year-old Juliet was born in Fadugu Village. A wife, Juliet has been a teacher for 29 years now. She has requested this loan in order to purchase additional house-building materials, like iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, iron rods, etc., for the completion of a house she is building.

loans.use: to purchase additional house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, iron rods, etc., for the completion of a house she is building

loans.name: Abu Bakarr D.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a primary school in the village of Yogomaia, in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of 13,200,000.00 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, these teachers will repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment from their salaries and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Abu is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in the village of Mussaia, the fifty-five-year-old is married. Abu has been a teacher for thirty-three years. He is going to use his share of the loan to buy building materials for the construction of a house. He will also use part of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and only  two of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, plates, beef, chicken, flour, and bananas. 

Her major business challenges are defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build a house and to own a fully stocked restaurant. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, cooking oil, beef, maize flour, chicken and plates.

loans.name: Eron

texts.en:
Eroni lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with ten children, six of whom go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (grandchildren). She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She also gets additional income from rearing chickens. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last ten years. 

Eroni has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to get a shop where she can sell her clothes from. She lives in her own house. The family has no access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Anani est  un homme âgé de 21 ans. Il est célibataire et a 01 enfant.
Anani travaille comme revendeur d’appareils DVD, CD depuis 2005. Il vend seul  dans un quartier de la place et achète à Lomé.
Anani a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des CD et autres. Son profit lui servira à prendre soin de son enfant.
texts.en:
Anani is a 21-year old man who is single and has one child. He has worked as a retailer of DVD recorders and CDs since 2005 and sells his products alone in a local neighborhood. He buys his products in Lomé.

Anani has requested his first loan from WAGES so that he can buy CDs and other goods. His profits will allow him to take care of his child.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and CDs

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (nephews). She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

She has a clinic in a shop that she rents. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for the last 10 years. She also gets additional income from working as a nurse at a nearby school. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of drugs for her clinic. Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves. Her goal is to expand her clinic into a level-3 health center.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her clinic.

loans.name: Mibane

texts.fr:
Mibane est une femme  âgée de 23 ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Mibane travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation depuis 2008. Elle vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place et achète les produits au Grand marché de Lomé.
Mibane a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité pour mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Mibane is a 23-year old woman, who is single and has no children. She has worked as a retailer of groceries since 2008, and sells her products to her customers in a local market. She buys her products at Lomé's Grand Market.

Mibane has requested her third loan from WAGES so that she can buy groceries. She wants to reinvest in her business so that she can provide more easily for her own needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila, de 31 años, una mujer empeñosa y dedicada a su hogar, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Felimon de 35 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brinda amor y buen futuro. Cirila, desde muy joven empezó a ocuparse en el cultivo de café en los campos verdes de su localidad, una comunidad donde todos los pobladores se brindan apoyo en las cosechas. Hace 17 años que se ocupa a labrar la tierra para luego sembrar plantas de café  en su propio campo de cultivo; con la ayuda de su pareja y de algunos vecinos de su comunidad logran efectuar su labor. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es obtener buenos frutos después de arduo sacrificio. De hecho, Cirila  comenta que no dejará  de producir café ya que es rentable para el sustento de su hogar, por lo tanto no descuidará  sus plantaciones realizando el mantenimiento correspondiente. Este será su crédito numero 04 con MFP, se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brindan. En su banco comunal es una mujer solidaria y responsable.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá contratar jornaleros para que le ayuden con el desmonte de sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Cirila, 31, lives with her partner, Felimon, 35, and their 3 children.  Cirila is from a town where everyone earns their living from farming and she started working in the green fields there when she was just a girl.  She has had her own farm, growing coffee, for 17 years now.  She operates the farm with help from her partner, Felimon, and a few neighbors.  What she most likes about the business is harversting her crop, reaping the benefits of the very hard work before.  She tells us that she'll never stop growing coffee, despite the effort to care for coffee plants, because she can make more money from it to support her family than she can from any other crop.  This will be Cirila's fourth MFP loan and she says she is happy with the support she's received from her community bank.  The other members of the community bank consider her to be a supportive and responsible member of the bank.
Cirilia will use this 2,000 new soles loan to hire day laborers to help her harvest her coffee crop.

loans.use: to hire day laborers for her farming business.

loans.name: Belquiz

texts.es: Belquiz se provisionó bien de cárnicos y compró implementos de trabajo con su credikiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a uno nuevo con el cual comprará carne en mayor cantidad, pues sus clientes han aumentado especialmente en el conjunto residencial donde vive y esto le augura una buena venta, como la anterior. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente. “  Agradecimientos a los señores de Kiva por confiar en ella y darle la oportunidad de desarrollar este proyecto familiar“
texts.en: Belquiz stocked up well, buying meat products and work tools with her Kiva loan.  She is currently applying for a new loan which she will use to buy meat in larger quantities as her number of customers has increased, especially in the residential development in which she lives.  This bodes well for good sales like she achieved before.  Her message for lenders is the following: "Thanks to Kiva people for trusting in me and giving me the opportunity to develop this family project".

loans.use: to buy meat in larger quantities

loans.name: Mawugnigan

texts.fr:
Mawugnigan est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est  célibataire.  
Mawugnigan travaille comme revendeur de cartes de recharges depuis 2010. Il vend à domicile et à toutes personnes dans les environs de Lomé après achat dans les sociétés de vente de cartes. 
Mawugnigan a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de cartes pour mieux répondre à la demande de la population.
texts.en:
Mawugnigan is a 26-year old man who is single. He has worked as a retailer of recharge cards since 2010. He buys his cards from companies specialised in the sale of such cards and resells them at home to all sorts of people in the surroundings of Lomé.

Mawugnigan has requested his first loan from WAGES so that he can buy more cards to respond better to demand.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is sixty-nine years old. Erlinda is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Erlinda runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products to the local community. Erlinda has been in her business for five years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Erlinda is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita, sixty-seven, is a widow with four children. She is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She used her last loan to purchase daily-use commodities to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members. She lives in her own house; the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Aisha sells secondhand clothes at the market. She works six days a week and has been in this business for the last three years. She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation, increasing prices of secondhand clothes, and seasonality. Her goal is to expand her business into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school .She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Eva sells new clothes in a retail shop. She works seven days a week and has been in business for the last ten years. She also has rental houses from which she gets additional income. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy new dresses, skirs, shirts, and blouses to sell.

loans.use: to buy more dresses, skirts, shirts, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 37 years old.  A businessman, he is married with three children aged 10, eight and five years respectively. He has been running a retail shop for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Joshua will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and maize meal for his business

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with one child. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

She has a clinic in a shop in her home. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for the last two years. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy drugs for her clinic. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Her goal is to expand her clinic into a level-4 health center.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her clinic.

loans.name: Bena

texts.en:
Bena lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children and none of  her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She sells baby clothes door-to-door on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last five years. She also has rental houses where she gets additional income. 

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used baby clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and build more rental houses and also to get a permanent business premise. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Madjé

texts.fr:
Madjé est une femme âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un comptable dans une société de la place.  
Madjé travaille comme revendeuse de produits congelés depuis 2011. Elle vend dans un quartier de la place après achat à Lomé.
Madjé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises pour satisfaire sa clientèle afin d’aider son mari dans les taches du foyer.
texts.en:
Madié is a 26-year old woman, who is married to an accountant who works in a local company. She has worked as a retailer of frozen foods since 2011 and sells her products in a local neighborhood after she has bought them in Lomé. 

Madié has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy more goods to satisfy customer demand and thereby help her husband with the household chores.

loans.use: to buy frozen food

loans.name: Sapia

texts.en:
Sapia is married. She is twenty-nine years old, and resides in Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Sapia operates a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for ten years and earns PHP 2,000 a month from it. She requested a loan of PHP 4,500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

In 2008, Sapia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Sapia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 41 años, un señor responsable, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Lucia de 41 años y sus 05 estimados hijos a quienes desea brindar un buen bienestar. Cesar, es un hombre de lucro se dedica con mucho cuidado a sembrar  plantaciones de café, actividad que realiza hace mas de 31 años. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de jornaleros, de esa manera extrae rápido los frutos para luego venderlas en los centros de acopio, quienes le gratifican buena ganancia por cada kilogramo de café. A pesar de todo le resulta difícil el transportar su sacos de cosecha hasta la localidad de Palpamapampa lugar donde se encuentran las empresas acopiadoras.
